headline: Chipotle Mexican Grill cuts same-store sales outlook as rising costs bite
summary: Investing.com – Chipotle Mexican Grill reported third-quarter revenue that missed expectations Wednesday and cut its annual same-store sales forecast as consumer spending was held back by macroeconomic pressured at time when rising costs are weighing on margins.

headline: Chipotle’s Earnings Perfectly Matched Estimates. Why the Stock Is Dropping.
summary: Chipotle Mexican Grill’s  third-quarter results were a near-perfect match with Wall Street’s projections.  Chipotle posted third-quarter earnings of 29 cents a share from $3 billion in revenue, while same-store sales rose 0.3%.

summary: Mexican fast-food chain Chipotle (NYSE:CMG) met Wall Streets revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 7.5% year on year to $3.00 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.29 per share was in line with analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Chipotle Consumers Curbing Visits, Stock Plunges
summary: Shares in Chipotle Mexican Grill fell more than 11% in after-hours trading after the restaurant chain warned that economic strains are turning customers away from its stores.  Young people and low-income customers, buffeted by inflation, unemployment and slower wage growth, are eating fewer burritos, Chipotle Chief Executive Scott Boatwright told analysts on a Wednesday conference call.  Guests with household incomes below $100,000 represent 40% of the chain’s sales.

Guests with household incomes below $100,000 represent 40% of the chain’s sales.

headline: Chipotle stock drags on Q3 revenue miss, sales guidance cut
summary: Chipotle Mexican Grill (CMG) just missed third quarter revenue expectations ($3.0 billion vs. estimates of $3.02 billion) while the food chain's adjusted earnings per share came out just in line with Wall Street's forecasts ($0.29 per share). Placer.ai Head of Analytical Research R.J. Hottovy joins Josh Lipton in taking a deeper look into Chipotle's figures as the company cuts its sales outlook for another consecutive quarter. Also catch R.J. Hottovy's analysis of Starbucks' (SBUX) latest earnings release. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.
